snippet: While the Afghan president was in Pakistan for meetings on restarting peace talks, the Taliban besieged buildings in Kandahar, casting doubt on their interest in diplomacy.
abstract: Pakistan, Afghanistan and United States again agree to restart peace talks with Taliban, but it it is unclear whether Taliban, which had just conducted 2-day siege of Kandahar, will participate.

byline.original: By MUJIB MASHAL and ROD NORDLAND
byline.contributor: Mujib Mashal reported from Kabul, and Rod Nordland from Islamabad, Pakistan. Taimoor Shah contributed reporting from Kandahar, Afghanistan, and Jawad Sukhanyar from Kabul.

lead_paragraph: While the Afghan president was in Pakistan for meetings on restarting peace talks, the Taliban besieged buildings in Kandahar, casting doubt on their interest in diplomacy.

headline.main: Afghanistan and Pakistan Agree to Reopen Talks With an Absent Taliban
headline.print_headline: Afghanistan and Pakistan Agree to Taliban Talks
